org.reso

Class Commander

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.reso.Commander

  • public class Commander
extends java.lang.Object
    URI Most of the work done by the WebAPI commander is done by this class. Its public methods are, therefore, the ones the Client programmer is expected to use.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Commander.Builder
      Builder pattern implemented for creating Commander instances

    • Constructor Detail

      • Commander

        public Commander(java.lang.String serviceRoot,
                 java.lang.String bearerToken,
                 boolean useEdmEnabledClient)
        Creates a Commander instance that uses the given Bearer token for authentication and allows the Client to specify whether to use an EdmEnabledClient or normal OData client.

        NOTE: serviceRoot can sometimes be null, but is required if useEdmEnabledClient is true. A check has been added for this condition. *

        Parameters:
        serviceRoot - the service root of the WebAPI server.
        bearerToken - the bearer token to use to authenticate with the given serviceRoot.
        useEdmEnabledClient - if true, the payload is checked against the Server's metadata for actions that support it.

    • Method Detail

      • getMetadata

        public org.apache.olingo.commons.api.edm.Edm getMetadata(java.lang.String outputFileName)
        Gets server metadata in EDMX format.

        TODO: add optional validation upon fetch

        Returns:
        Edm representation of the server metadata.

      • validateMetadata

        public boolean validateMetadata(org.apache.olingo.client.api.edm.xml.XMLMetadata metadata)
        Validates given XMLMetadata
        Parameters:
        metadata - the XMLMetadata to be validated
        Returns:
        true if the metadata is valid, meaning that it's also a valid OData 4 Service Document

      • validateMetadata

        public boolean validateMetadata(java.lang.String pathToEdmx)
        Validates the given metadata contained in the given file path.
        Parameters:
        pathToEdmx - the path to look for metadata in. Assumes metadata is stored as XML.
        Returns:
        true if the metadata is valid and false otherwise.

      • saveRawGetRequest

        public void saveRawGetRequest(java.lang.String requestUri,
                              java.lang.String outputFilePath)
        Executes a get request on URI and saves raw response to outputFilePath.
        Parameters:
        requestUri - the URI to make the request against
        outputFilePath - the outputFilePath to write the response to

      • getEntitySet

        public org.apache.olingo.client.api.domain.ClientEntitySet getEntitySet(java.lang.String requestUri,
                                                                        java.lang.Integer limit)
        Reads entities from a given TODO: add a function that can write a page at a time. TODO: add a parallel function which can create n queries at a time and download their results
        Parameters:
        requestUri - the request URI to read from.
        limit - the limit for the number of records to read from the Server. Use -1 to fetch all.
        Returns:
        a ClientEntitySet containing any entities found.

      • convertMetadata

        public void convertMetadata(java.lang.String pathToEDMX)
        Converts metadata in EDMX format to metadata in Swagger 2.0 format. Converted file will have the same name as the input file, with .swagger.json appended to the name.
        Parameters:
        pathToEDMX - the metadata file to convert.

      • serializeEntitySet

        public void serializeEntitySet(org.apache.olingo.client.api.domain.ClientEntitySet entitySet,
                               java.lang.String outputFilePath,
                               org.apache.olingo.commons.api.format.ContentType contentType)
        Writes an Entity Set to the given outputFilePath.
        Parameters:
        entitySet - - the ClientEntitySet to serialize.
        outputFilePath - - the path to write the file to.
        contentType - - the OData content type to write with. Currently supported options are JSON, JSON_NO_METADATA, JSON_FULL_METADATA, and XML.

      • serializeEntitySet

        public void serializeEntitySet(org.apache.olingo.client.api.domain.ClientEntitySet entitySet,
                               java.lang.String outputFilePath)
        Writes the given entitySet to the given outputFilePath. Writes in JSON format.
        Parameters:
        entitySet - the ClientEntitySet to serialize.
        outputFilePath - the outputFilePath used to write to.

      • getContentType

        public static org.apache.olingo.commons.api.format.ContentType getContentType(java.lang.String contentType)
        Translates supported string formats into those of ContentType.

        See: https://olingo.apache.org/javadoc/odata4/org/apache/olingo/commons/api/format/ContentType.html#TEXT_HTML

        Parameters:
        contentType - the string representation of the requested content type.
        Returns:
        one of ContentType if a match is found, or ContentType.JSON if no other format is available.
